text:
Hello — Just getting started with scoping a build for my company's website to live on the HubSpot CMS.

The question I have is around local testing. As I design/build the theme, I'm a bit unsure of what the best way is to iteratively test my local updates in real-time with a local server.

From what I researched in both documentation and in past Slack discussions here, it seems like the best practice is

➜ Set up two portals in the YAML, one for my `production` real HubSpot account, and one using the `sandbox` account
➜ Set `watch` on my directory, but have it sync to `sandbox`
➜ When I'm ready to "deploy", I switch from the sandbox portal profile to the `production` one

Is that still the suggested best practice for a development workflow?
Thanks!

I just saw this thread in a different channel now. Looks like what I stated is indeed still the best practice. URL suggested is this one: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>
Sharing here for others in the future who search in Slack.

Do you want to create a custom blog listing or blog detail template? You can create a template for blog and set it through the settings. We use a custom module for our listing and the 'Blog Content' module for our blog detail pages. We also add a bunch of custom modules to the template for our blog detail page template.
You can than use the variables available for blog (set through the content object) as described here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#blog-variables>
